Key Match Events: Chimwemwe Idana scored in the 9th minute
Youssef Msakni scored a penalty in the 88th minute
Pre-Game Insights: Malawi have never lost in three previous home fixtures against Tunisia
Tunisia have not been beaten at home in a World Cup qualification fixture since June 2008
Malawi have only been behind in two of their last nine matches in all competitions
Post-Match Reflections: Malawi's caretaker manager Patrick Mabedi's side have been much more organised defensively, posting six clean sheets in his nine matches at the helm
Miscellaneous Highlights: Malawi have not faced a side with as much quality as Tunisia in quite some time
Tunisia have only lost one of their last 20 second-round World Cup qualification fixtures
Others: Malawi possible starting lineup: Munthali; M'Balaka, Chaziya, Chembezi, Sanudi; Aaron, Mpinganjira, J. Banda; Mphasi, Kanjira, Nkhoma
Tunisia possible starting lineup: Ben Said; Kechrida, Meriah, Talbi, Cherni; Rafia, Skhiri, Tka; Sliti, Jouini, Msakni
